segment.source: Finalize the operating system configuration for Windows 10 deployment with Configuration Manager (Windows 10)
segment.target: Finalize the operating system configuration for Windows 10 deployment with Configuration Manager (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic walks you through the steps to finalize the configuration of your Windows 10 operating deployment, which includes enablement of the optional Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) monitoring for Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager, logs folder creation, rules configuration, content distribution, and deployment of the previously created task sequence.
segment.target: This topic walks you through the steps to finalize the configuration of your Windows 10 operating deployment, which includes enablement of the optional Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) monitoring for Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager, logs folder creation, rules configuration, content distribution, and deployment of the previously created task sequence.

segment.source: Finalize the operating system configuration for Windows 10 deployment with Configuration Manager
segment.target: Finalize the operating system configuration for Windows 10 deployment with Configuration Manager

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: This topic walks you through the steps to finalize the configuration of your Windows 10 operating deployment, which includes enablement of the optional Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) monitoring for Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager, logs folder creation, rules configuration, content distribution, and deployment of the previously created task sequence.
segment.target: This topic walks you through the steps to finalize the configuration of your Windows 10 operating deployment, which includes enablement of the optional Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) monitoring for Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager, logs folder creation, rules configuration, content distribution, and deployment of the previously created task sequence.

segment.source: For the purposes of this topic, we will use two machines: DC01 and CM01.
segment.target: For the purposes of this topic, we will use two machines: DC01 and CM01.

segment.source: DC01 is a domain controller and CM01 is a machine running Windows Server 2012 R2 Standard.
segment.target: DC01 is a domain controller and CM01 is a machine running Windows Server 2012 R2 Standard.

segment.source: Both are members of the domain contoso.com for the fictitious Contoso Corporation.
segment.target: Both are members of the domain contoso.com for the fictitious Contoso Corporation.

segment.source: For more details on the setup for this topic, please see Deploy Windows 10 with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit.
segment.target: For more details on the setup for this topic, please see Deploy Windows 10 with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit.

segment.source: Enable MDT monitoring
segment.target: Enable MDT monitoring

segment.source: This section will walk you through the process of creating the E:MDTProduction deployment share using the MDT Deployment Workbench to enable monitoring for Configuration Manager.
segment.target: This section will walk you through the process of creating the E:MDTProduction deployment share using the MDT Deployment Workbench to enable monitoring for Configuration Manager.

segment.source: On CM01, using the Deployment Workbench, right-click Deployment Shares and select New Deployment Share.
segment.target: On CM01, using the Deployment Workbench, right-click Deployment Shares and select New Deployment Share.

segment.source: Use the following settings for the New Deployment Share Wizard:
segment.target: Use the following settings for the New Deployment Share Wizard:

segment.source: Deployment share path: E:MDTProduction
segment.target: Deployment share path: E:MDTProduction

segment.source: Share name: MDTProduction$
segment.target: Share name: MDTProduction$

segment.source: Deployment share description: MDT Production
segment.target: Deployment share description: MDT Production

segment.source: Options: default settings
segment.target: Options: default settings

segment.source: Right-click the MDT Production deployment share, and select Properties.
segment.target: Right-click the MDT Production deployment share, and select Properties.

segment.source: In the Monitoring tab, select the Enable monitoring for this deployment share check box, and click OK.
segment.target: In the Monitoring tab, select the Enable monitoring for this deployment share check box, and click OK.

segment.source: figure 26
segment.target: figure 26

segment.source: Figure 26.
segment.target: Figure 26.

segment.source: Enabling MDT monitoring for Configuration Manager.
segment.target: Enabling MDT monitoring for Configuration Manager.

segment.source: Create and share the Logs folder
segment.target: Create and share the Logs folder

segment.source: To support additional server-side logging in Configuration Manager, you create and share the E:Logs folder on CM01 using Windows PowerShell.
segment.target: To support additional server-side logging in Configuration Manager, you create and share the E:Logs folder on CM01 using Windows PowerShell.

segment.source: Then in the next step, you enable server-side logging by modifying the CustomSettings.ini file used by the Configuration Manager task sequence.
segment.target: Then in the next step, you enable server-side logging by modifying the CustomSettings.ini file used by the Configuration Manager task sequence.

segment.source: On CM01, start an elevated Windows PowerShell prompt (run as Administrator).
segment.target: On CM01, start an elevated Windows PowerShell prompt (run as Administrator).

segment.source: Type the following commands, pressing Enter after each one:
segment.target: Type the following commands, pressing Enter after each one:

segment.source: Configure the rules (Windows 10 x64 Settings package)
segment.target: Configure the rules (Windows 10 x64 Settings package)

segment.source: This section will show you how to configure the rules (the Windows 10 x64 Settings package) to support the Contoso environment.
segment.target: This section will show you how to configure the rules (the Windows 10 x64 Settings package) to support the Contoso environment.

segment.source: On CM01, using File Explorer, navigate to the E:SourcesOSDSettingsWindows 10 x64 Settings folder.
segment.target: On CM01, using File Explorer, navigate to the E:SourcesOSDSettingsWindows 10 x64 Settings folder.

segment.source: Using Notepad, edit the CustomSetting.ini file with the following settings:
segment.target: Using Notepad, edit the CustomSetting.ini file with the following settings:

segment.source: figure 27
segment.target: figure 27

segment.source: Figure 27.
segment.target: Figure 27.

segment.source: The Settings package, holding the rules and the Unattend.xml template used during deployment
segment.target: The Settings package, holding the rules and the Unattend.xml template used during deployment

segment.source: Update the distribution point for the Windows 10 x64 Settings package by right-clicking the Windows 10 x64 Settings package and selecting Update Distribution Points.
segment.target: Update the distribution point for the Windows 10 x64 Settings package by right-clicking the Windows 10 x64 Settings package and selecting Update Distribution Points.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Although you have not yet added a distribution point, you still need to select Update Distribution Points.
segment.target: Although you have not yet added a distribution point, you still need to select Update Distribution Points.

segment.source: That process also updates the Configuration Manager 2012 content library with changes.
segment.target: That process also updates the Configuration Manager 2012 content library with changes.

segment.source: Distribute content to the CM01 distribution portal
segment.target: Distribute content to the CM01 distribution portal

segment.source: In Configuration Manager, you can distribute all packages needed by a task sequence in a single task.
segment.target: In Configuration Manager, you can distribute all packages needed by a task sequence in a single task.

segment.source: In this section, you distribute packages that have not yet been distributed to the CM01 distribution point.
segment.target: In this section, you distribute packages that have not yet been distributed to the CM01 distribution point.

segment.source: On CM01, using the Configuration Manager Console, select Task Sequences, right-click the Windows 10 Enterprise x64 RTM task sequence, and select Distribute Content.
segment.target: On CM01, using the Configuration Manager Console, select Task Sequences, right-click the Windows 10 Enterprise x64 RTM task sequence, and select Distribute Content.

segment.source: In the Distribute Content Wizard, add the CM01 distribution point, and complete the wizard.
segment.target: In the Distribute Content Wizard, add the CM01 distribution point, and complete the wizard.

segment.source: Using Configuration Manager Trace, verify the distribution to the CM01 distribution point by reviewing the distmgr.log file, or use the Distribution Status / Content Status option in the Monitoring workspace.
segment.target: Using Configuration Manager Trace, verify the distribution to the CM01 distribution point by reviewing the distmgr.log file, or use the Distribution Status / Content Status option in the Monitoring workspace.

segment.source: Do not continue until you see all the new packages being distributed successfully.
segment.target: Do not continue until you see all the new packages being distributed successfully.

segment.source: Create a deployment for the task sequence
segment.target: Create a deployment for the task sequence

segment.source: This sections provides steps to help you create a deployment for the task sequence.
segment.target: This sections provides steps to help you create a deployment for the task sequence.

segment.source: On CM01, using the Configuration Manager Console, select Task Sequences, right-click Windows 10 Enterprise x64 RTM, and then select Deploy.
segment.target: On CM01, using the Configuration Manager Console, select Task Sequences, right-click Windows 10 Enterprise x64 RTM, and then select Deploy.

segment.source: On the General page, select the All Unknown Computers collection and click Next.
segment.target: On the General page, select the All Unknown Computers collection and click Next.

segment.source: On the Deployment Settings page, use the following settings and then click Next:
segment.target: On the Deployment Settings page, use the following settings and then click Next:

segment.source: Purpose: Available
segment.target: Purpose: Available

segment.source: Make available to the following: Only media and PXE
segment.target: Make available to the following: Only media and PXE

segment.source: figure 28
segment.target: figure 28

segment.source: Figure 28.
segment.target: Figure 28.

segment.source: Configure the deployment settings.
segment.target: Configure the deployment settings.

segment.source: On the Scheduling page, accept the default settings and click Next.
segment.target: On the Scheduling page, accept the default settings and click Next.

segment.source: On the User Experience page, accept the default settings and click Next.
segment.target: On the User Experience page, accept the default settings and click Next.

segment.source: On the Alerts page, accept the default settings and click Next.
segment.target: On the Alerts page, accept the default settings and click Next.

segment.source: On the Distribution Points page, accept the default settings, click Next twice, and then click Close.
segment.target: On the Distribution Points page, accept the default settings, click Next twice, and then click Close.

segment.source: figure 29
segment.target: figure 29

segment.source: Figure 29.
segment.target: Figure 29.

segment.source: The Windows 10 Enterprise x64 RTM task sequence deployed to the All Unknown Computers collections available for media and PXE.
segment.target: The Windows 10 Enterprise x64 RTM task sequence deployed to the All Unknown Computers collections available for media and PXE.

segment.source: Configure Configuration Manager to prompt for the computer name during deployment (optional)
segment.target: Configure Configuration Manager to prompt for the computer name during deployment (optional)

segment.source: You can have Configuration Manager prompt you for a computer name or you can use rules to generate a computer name.
segment.target: You can have Configuration Manager prompt you for a computer name or you can use rules to generate a computer name.

segment.source: For more details on how to do this, see Configure MDT settings.
segment.target: For more details on how to do this, see Configure MDT settings.

segment.source: This section provides steps to help you configure the All Unknown Computers collection to have Configuration Manager prompt for computer names.
segment.target: This section provides steps to help you configure the All Unknown Computers collection to have Configuration Manager prompt for computer names.

segment.source: Using the Configuration Manager Console, in the Asset and Compliance workspace, select Device Collections, right-click All Unknown Computers, and select Properties.
segment.target: Using the Configuration Manager Console, in the Asset and Compliance workspace, select Device Collections, right-click All Unknown Computers, and select Properties.

segment.source: In the Collection Variables tab, create a new variable with the following settings:
segment.target: In the Collection Variables tab, create a new variable with the following settings:

segment.source: Name: OSDComputerName
segment.target: Name: OSDComputerName

segment.source: Clear the Do not display this value in the Configuration Manager console check box.
segment.target: Clear the Do not display this value in the Configuration Manager console check box.

segment.source: Click OK.
segment.target: Click OK.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Configuration Manager can prompt for information in many ways.
segment.target: Configuration Manager can prompt for information in many ways.

segment.source: Using a collection variable with an empty value is just one of them.
segment.target: Using a collection variable with an empty value is just one of them.

segment.source: Another option is the User-Driven Installation (UDI) wizard.
segment.target: Another option is the User-Driven Installation (UDI) wizard.

segment.source: figure 30
segment.target: figure 30

segment.source: Figure 30.
segment.target: Figure 30.

segment.source: Configure a collection variable.
segment.target: Configure a collection variable.
